title: Font Name
content:
I’d appreciate any help in naming and locating this font. As memory serves, I was given it, used it once, then evaporated it from my files. Now, of course, a client has seen and is love with it. [And as you can tell from the file name, my typing is also erratic.]

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [thsnk-you-w-flowered-caps,-2nd-version.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830004428/http:/typophile.com/files/thsnk-you-w-flowered-caps,-2nd-version.jpg) | 40.24 KB |

 [‹ Number 100](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830004428/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47028 "Go to previous forum topic") [Smallcaps special characters - what is useful? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830004428/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46950 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mgking

comments.content:
Hi Michael,

that are the lovely [Koch Initialen](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830004428/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/k/kochinits.htm).  
(Btw: This belongs on the [Type ID Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830004428/http:/typophile.com/forum/29) – next time.)  
F
Thank you and sorry. haven’t posted much and the note I read said to post here. Guess I should I should have read further. Thanks again.

Something i try to do when naming is... know the influences or something like “what does this remember me...”  
For example, on my Hausi the name went through a long way. It remembered me of Bauhaus, then it came me across Bauhausian and... then Hausi!  
It’s a easy way to name it ehehe...

Joel Santos // youremin  
sound & visual
